column1: Local Foods////My not so favorites are the crunchy chicken
column3: and corned beef. I don't know about you
column4: but when I hear "crunchy chicken" I think of a chicken breast cutlet battered in some type of cornmeal breading and lightly fried. When I got my sandwich
column5: I was surprised to see semi-thick slices of chicken and the "crunchy" part was fulfilled by potato chips. I don't get it. What's so special about this one? Actually
column6: both the chicken and corned beef were somewhat dry and flavorless. There's not enough other toppings in the sandwich to compensate either.
